definition: to keep up with the latest fashion

sentences.english: The lady is trying on a fashionable hat.
sentences.chinese: 那位女士正在試戴一頂時髦的帽子。

sentences.english: Colors embody the vivid characteristics of the age and fashion.
sentences.chinese: 色彩是賦有鮮明的時代感和時髦性的。
我現在講話都很時髦的。

sentences.english: At present, homophonic transliteration has become a fashion in the translation of trademarks.
sentences.chinese: 時下，諧音譯在商標翻譯中成爲一種時髦。

sentences.english: I dressed well and talked to staff in the store.
sentences.chinese: 我穿得很體面時髦，並且輕快的跟店員交談。

sentences.english: It's quite trendy now. It's where the Olympic Games is going to happen,
sentences.chinese: 那裏現在相當時髦了。那是奧運會將要舉辦的場地，
她穿着一件時髦的禮服。

sentences.english: It was a lesson to me not to follow fads.
sentences.chinese: 這對我來說是個教訓，即不要趕時髦。

sentences.english: My wife likes to follow the fashion.
Carrie had thought of going for a walk, and had put on a light grey woollen dress with a jaunty double-breasted jacket.
sentences.chinese: 她已穿上淡灰羊毛女裝，外罩一件時髦的雙排扣上裝。

sentences.english: There are many upscale fashion shops and trendy boutiques in the area.
sentences.chinese: 有許多高檔時裝店和時髦的精品屋領域。

sentences.english: The doors were newer and looked more modern compared with the unpainted wooden doors of the older ones.
sentences.chinese: 新房大門和舊房子沒有油漆的木門比起來更新更時髦。

sentences.english: The of pet these days is the pot—bellied pig.
sentences.chinese: 當今最時髦的一種寵物是大肚豬。

sentences.english: I liked him. He was always well-dressed and smart-looking.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡他，他一向穿着考究，看上去很時髦。
時髦的外觀及四面保護設計。

sentences.english: Prevailing fashions with vivid patterns and lively designs are the choice of stylish ladies.
sentences.chinese: 流行時裝，圖案生動，款式新穎，時髦女性的選擇。

definition: to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
